thread.title: Rita Simons slams Eastenders as Albert Square blames Roxy Mitchell for Ronnie Mitchell's death
thread.title_full: Rita Simons slams Eastenders as Albert Square blames Roxy Mitchell for Ronnie Mitchell's death

author: Joshua Haigh
title: Rita Simons slams Eastenders as Albert Square blames Roxy Mitchell for Ronnie Mitchell's death
text:
Rita Simons slams Eastenders as Albert Square blames Roxy Mitchell for Ronnie Mitchell's death Jack Branning has blamed his wife's death on Ronnie's shocking drug habit Share Rita isn't happy (Photo: BBC) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
She only just left EastEnders, but Rita Simons has already stopped watching the BBC soap. 
The actress went out with a bang after her character, Roxy Mitchell, met a watery end alongside her sister, Ronnie Mitchell, on New Years Eve. 
But after hearing about the latest episodes of the soap, Rita has taken to Twitter to slam the show for making her to blame for Ronnie's death. 
In the shocking episode, Roxy fell into a swimming pool after suffering from a heart attack - with Jack Branning claiming that drugs were to blame. Roxy and Ronnie died on New Years Eve (Photo: BBC) 
Hitting back at the show on Twitter, Rita said: "Don't watch Enders anymore so forgive me if I'm misinformed. But from what I hear..is ANYONE mourning Roxy on the square? Poor cow!" 
Many viewers agreed with the actress's frustrations, and claimed that no one made Ronnie jump in th pool to save her. Jack's blamed Roxy for Ronnie's death (Photo: BBC) 
"@ConnorBenson2 @OfficialRita no, Ronnie decided to jump in and save her Roxy didn't make her," wrote one fan. 
Another added: " OfficialRita Worst thing Enders ever did was get rid of you and Sam_Womack!" Read More 
After almost a decade playing half of the Mitchell sisters duo, Rita did not rule out the possibility of joining another soap but even after being killed off . Rita might move to another soap (Photo: BBC) 
After her final episode was broadcast, Essex-born Simons, 39, told the Press Association: "I would never say never, but my heart is probably always going to be with EastEnders. 
"It's such a massive part of my life and I do love that place. Honestly, I have a huge loyalty to EastEnders at the moment." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
